title: Big changes coming to Ethereum’s account abstraction to save on gas
description:
Ethereum ‘smart accounts’ are getting tweaked in an upgrade that will reduce gas usage on layer-2 networks.

The Ethereum Foundation is set to push through major changes to the account abstraction standard in Ethereum in a bid to reduce gas consumption — particularly for layer-2s.

On Jan. 10, the Ethereum Foundation shared a preview of the drastic changes to the ERC-4337 standard specification, which deals with account abstraction, also known as smart accounts.

The new version 0.7 applies learnings from nine months of ERC-4337 being used, according to developer John Rising in an update shared with Cointelegraph.

Read more

title: Coinbase partners with Yellow Card to expand USDC access in Africa
description:
Coinbase integrated Yellow Card’s payment rails, enabling Coinbase customers in Africa to more easily on and off-ramp between fiat and crypto, including USD Coin.

Cryptocurrency exchange Coinbase has partnered with Africa's Yellow Card to expand access to its products to 20 new African countries — with a focus on increasing USD Coin (USDC) stablecoin access.

“Our new partnership [...] will help usher in the future of money by giving millions of users access to USDC and fast, reliable, cheaper transactions on our decentralized, open L2 Base through both Coinbase and Yellow Card products,” Coinbase said in a Jan. 11 statement.

South Africa, Nigeria, Zimbabwe, Kenya and Ghana are the top five African countries adopting Bitcoin, according to BitcoinAfrica.io.

Read more

title: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman Ties the Knot with Aussie Partner Oliver Mulherin in Seaside Ceremony Amidst Criticism and Speculation
description: In a surprising turn of events, OpenAI CEO Sam Altman has made headlines not for his groundbreaking work in artificial intelligence but for a personal milestone – his marriage to Oliver Mulherin, a software engineer hailing from Australia. The private ceremony, set against a tropical backdrop, has become the subject of social media speculation after […]
